result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Steven G Lubahn was found guilty of OWI (3rd w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Steven G Lubahn in court with attorney Thomas Patrick Grieve.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1. Court conducts colloquy. Court passes the matter to allow the defendant to speak with his attorney. Court recalls the matter at 2:46 pm. Court finds defendant guilty. Count 2 is dismissed by operation of law.

Court orders the following: 
- Sentence withheld 4 Days Credit if revoked
-  2 years Probation
-  48 months Drivers License Revocation. 
-  48 months Ignition Interlock on any vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to defendant 
- Alcohol Assessment
- Attendance at the Victim Impact Panel already completed
- Fine of $6849.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation Cash Bail to be applied. 
- Blood Test Reimbursement of $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to Oconomowoc Police Department
- DNA Surcharge and Sample WAIVED
- Conditions of Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.  No contact with F. R.

CONDITION TIME: 200 Days - NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - To commence FORTHWITH.
A letter from the defendant, a copy of WCS reports received by the Court, IID information, Character letters, and a letter from the treatment provider.
Character letter filed
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Steven G Lubahn in court with attorney Thomas Grieve.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Defendant is applying to Alcohol Treatment Court.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 8, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant to have no contact with alleged witness listed in the Criminal Complaint that is not a family member.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program.   Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.   Not to discuss this case with any witness listed in the complaint.  Refund balance back to the poster.

Defendant Steven G Lubahn in court with attorney Thomas Grieve.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense to file any motions within 30 days. Defense requests a modification in cash bond. Court modifies the cash bail to $3,000.00. Defendant previously posted $5,000, $2,000 to be refunded to poster.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 8, 2015 at 09:30 am.
